alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"At their crossing points plasma filaments in the laboratory also emit synchrotron radiation, which is simply electromagnetic radiation caused by the rapid circular motion of charged particles in a magnetic field. This finding turned out to be an important clue to the plasma universe, because synchrotron radiation is also released from many natural cosmic sources."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Peratt on Cosmic Plasma Simulations - Part 2
